intro: Perakanthus velutinus, commonly known as the velvet perakanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
